title: How to Remove Male Pubic Hair Safely Without Shaving

steps.title: Purchase a depilatory cream safe for your pubic area.
steps.content: Purchase a depilatory cream safe for your pubic area. Depilatories have chemicals that dissolve the hair just below your skin so it doesn't grow back as quickly. [1] X Research source There are multiple depilatory creams on the market, so ensure you choose one that’s safe for intimate or private areas. Depilatories designed for the pubic area contain gentler chemicals that can cause less irritation. Depilatory creams are usually painless and effective but have a strong and unpleasant odor. They also don’t permanently remove hair. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Test the depilatory on your skin to see if you have a negative reaction.
steps.content: Test the depilatory on your skin to see if you have a negative reaction. Dab a quarter-sized amount of cream somewhere on your skin and leave it on for the amount of time listed on the package. Rinse the cream off once the time runs out or if you feel any burning or stinging. Keep an eye on your skin to see if you develop any irritation (redness, itchiness, etc.) over the next day. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Some people have allergic reactions to the chemicals in depilatory creams, so it’s important to try it before applying it around your pubic region. If you don’t notice any skin reactions, then the cream is safe for you to use. If you develop redness or a rash, find a different product or try a different method.

steps.title: Rub a thick layer of depilatory cream over your pubic area.
steps.content: Rub a thick layer of depilatory cream over your pubic area. Spread the cream evenly over your skin so it completely covers your pubic hair. Avoid rubbing the cream into your skin since it won’t be as effective. Immediately wash your hands right after applying the cream. [4] X Research source Do not apply depilatory cream on irritated skin or areas with cuts, scars, or moles since it can cause even more irritation.

steps.title: Leave the cream on your skin for the amount of time in the instructions.
steps.content: Leave the cream on your skin for the amount of time in the instructions. Look at the cream’s packaging to find out how long you need to leave it on your skin. While the cream sits on your skin, it will kill the hair so you can easily pull it away from your skin. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Times will vary depending on the brand you bought, but depilatory creams usually take 3 to 4 minutes to work. If you feel any burning or irritation, rinse the cream off immediately.

steps.title: Wipe the cream and hair off your skin with a tissue.
steps.content: Wipe the cream and hair off your skin with a tissue. Take a clean tissue and slowly drag it across your skin to remove the cream. Your pubic hair will easily wipe off, leaving your skin nice and smooth. Keep wiping your skin until you remove as much cream as possible. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse any remaining cream off your body and pat the skin dry.
steps.content: Rinse any remaining cream off your body and pat the skin dry. Hop in the shower or bath and rinse the area with lukewarm water to clean off any leftover cream. Your skin may feel a little sensitive, so gently pat the area dry with a towel. [7] X Research source You don’t need to use any lotion or moisturizer after depilatory cream. Hair typically doesn’t grow back for 2 weeks when using depilatory creams. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Use hard wax since it’s less painful.
steps.content: Use hard wax since it’s less painful. Soft wax requires cloth strips and it could feel more painful once it dries on your skin. Hard wax doesn’t require any strips, so it can be applied directly and removed as soon as it dries. [9] X Research source Waxing removes the hair down to the root, so it takes the longest for your hair to grow back, but it’s also the most painful method since you’re ripping the hair out. It may be a good choice for the area around your genitals, but not to use directly on them.

steps.title: Cut your hair to 1⁄4–3⁄4 in (0.64–1.91 cm) with trimming scissors.
steps.content: Cut your hair to 1 ⁄ 4 – 3 ⁄ 4 in (0.64–1.91 cm) with trimming scissors . Waxing works best with shorter pubic hair since it won’t pull your skin as much. Use trimming scissors or an electric trimmer to cut your pubic hair closer to your skin. Just work slowly and carefully so you don’t accidentally nick yourself. [10] X Research source Avoid using the same trimmers or scissors you use on your face since you could easily spread bacteria.

steps.title: Take over-the-counter pain medication 30 minutes before you wax.
steps.content: Take over-the-counter pain medication 30 minutes before you wax. Since waxing can be painful, take some ibuprofen or acetaminophen before you start. Follow the dosage instructions on the package and wait about 30 minutes for the medication to kick in. While you’ll still feel some pain and irritation, it won’t be as intense. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source You could also use ice packs to help numb your skin before you start waxing.

steps.title: Wash and dry the area you’re waxing.
steps.content: Wash and dry the area you’re waxing. Wax grips your hair better when it’s clean, so hop in your shower and gently clean your pubic area. Pat yourself completely dry with a towel to get the best results. [12] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Heat the wax
steps.content: Heat the wax until it’s warm and easy to apply. Read the label on the wax you bought to find the best way to heat and soften it. You can usually put the wax on the stove or in the oven until it’s melted, but follow the instructions they give you. Test a small spot of wax on your wrist to make sure it’s warm but not so hot that it hurts or burns you. [13] X Research source You can also buy a commercial wax warmer for more control over the temperature.

steps.title: Spread wax over a section of pubic hair with popsicle sticks and let it harden.
steps.content: Spread wax over a section of pubic hair with popsicle sticks and let it harden. Dip the end of the popsicle stick in the wax and scoop some onto a small section of your pubic hair. Spread the wax following the direction that your hair grows for the smoothest application and results. Leave the wax on your skin for a few minutes until it dries completely. [14] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Use popsicle sticks to apply your wax so you don’t get it all over your hands. While it may take more time to wax your pubic hair in sections, it causes less irritation later on.

steps.title: Pull the wax up quickly in the opposite direction of the hair.
steps.content: Pull the wax up quickly in the opposite direction of the hair. Hold your skin tight with one hand. Pinch the wax along the edge of the wax. Take a deep breath to prepare, and quickly pull the wax in the direction opposite of your hair growth. It might sting or feel painful for a moment, but it will go away soon. [15] X Research source If you’re having trouble pulling the wax on your own, ask a friend you trust to help. It typically takes 3 to 6 weeks for your hair to grow back before you need to wax again.

steps.title: Invest in a pair of trimming scissors or an electric body hair trimmer.
steps.content: Invest in a pair of trimming scissors or an electric body hair trimmer . Small trimming scissors are a lot easier to handle, especially around your pubic area. Alternatively, you can use a trimmer made for body hair that’s less likely to snag or pull while you’re trimming. Just be sure you use a guard to avoid pinching your skin. Use a different trimmer or scissors than what you’d use on your face so you don’t expose yourself to any bacteria.

steps.title: Wait until your pubic hair is dry.
steps.content: Wait until your pubic hair is dry. When you have wet hair, it gets a little harder to see what you’re trimming, so you could accidentally cut off too much hair or hurt yourself. If you just bathed or showered, dry off with your towel completely before you start trimming.

steps.title: Stand up straight so you can easily see what you're doing.
steps.content: Stand up straight so you can easily see what you're doing. It might seem easier to trim your pubic hair while lying down so you don’t have to crane your neck as much, but you won’t be able to see as well. You can get a better view of what you’re doing when you’re standing up and raising one leg, so try that instead. [16] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Stand over a wastebasket while trimming so you don’t have to clean up as much when you’re finished. Otherwise, trim in a room with hard floors so your hair is easier to sweep up.

steps.title: Snip or trim your pubic hair as close to your skin as you want.
steps.content: Snip or trim your pubic hair as close to your skin as you want. If you’re using scissors, pinch a few strands of pubic hair between your fingers and gently pull it taut. Slowly snip the hair to the length you want. Work your way around your pubic area, carefully trimming the rest of your hair. If you have electric trimmers, put on the guard for the length you want. Pull your skin tight and guide the trimmers in the same direction as your hair grows to reduce irritation. [17] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source The length of your pubic hair all depends on your personal preference. It might help to have a hand mirror if you’re trimming the hair around your testicles so you can get a better view of where you’re cutting. Trimming doesn’t completely remove your pubic hair, but it’s a good way to clean up any long or stray hairs.

steps.title: Sterilize your scissors or trimmer with rubbing alcohol afterward.
steps.content: Sterilize your scissors or trimmer with rubbing alcohol afterward. As soon as you finish trimming, wet a cloth with some rubbing alcohol and wipe down your scissors or trimmers. This will kill any harmful bacteria on the surface and prevent any infections when you use the scissors or trimmers in the future. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Get a wax at a salon if you don’t feel comfortable doing it yourself.
steps.content: Get a wax at a salon if you don’t feel comfortable doing it yourself. If it’s your first time or you just don’t feel confident waxing yourself, search for salons that offer pubic waxing in your area. Salon professionals can help you wax so you feel the least amount of pain and have the least risk of infection. [19] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source When an esthetician applies wax, they should use a new wooden stick each time. If they use the same stick multiple times, it could contaminate the wax and spread bacteria. [20] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Use electrolysis for an FDA-approved permanent treatment.
steps.content: Use electrolysis for an FDA-approved permanent treatment. During electrolysis, a dermatologist inserts a thin needle into your hair follicle that sends a small electric current to destroy the cells. While it’s usually painless, you may feel a pinch from the needle. You’ll typically need appointments every week or every other week for up to a year and a half to completely remove your hair, but it varies depending on how thick or coarse it is. [21] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Electrolysis appointments usually last 15 to 60 minutes. There are only slight risks of infection or scarring if the electrolysis is done incorrectly, but it’s very safe if you’re getting a professional treatment.

steps.title: Consider laser hair removal treatments for permanent removal.
steps.content: Consider laser hair removal treatments for permanent removal. Dermatologist Adarsh Vijay Mudgil explains that laser hair removal kills hair follicles with intense light so it doesn’t grow back. [22] X Expert Source Adarsh Vijay Mudgil, MD Board Certified Dermatologist & Dermatopathologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2020. You’ll usually need to make an appointment with a dermatologist or laser hair removal specialist every month until all your hair is gone since the lasers only work during the active growing cycle. However, sessions can be pretty pricey. [23] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Laser hair removal is only meant to target your pubic line and not your genitals, so it may not be the best option if you want to remove all of your pubic hair. Sometimes, you may still have some stray hairs grow in and have to make a maintenance appointment once a year to control them. Mudgil recommends getting laser hair removal done under the guidance of a board-certified dermatologist or plastic surgeon. [24] X Expert Source Adarsh Vijay Mudgil, MD Board Certified Dermatologist & Dermatopathologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2020.
